alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 10:20PM EDT until April 19 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Dickinson, Menominee and Marinette Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY, APRIL 19... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Niagara. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Wednesday, April 19. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, In the city of Niagara, water begins to cover the Niagara boat landing on Tyler Road...and water approaches homes along Sherman Street. This stage compares to a flow of 16500 cubic feet per second. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Thursday evening to a crest of 14.5 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early next Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 04/24/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
